clinical_study.brief_title: Reducing Cardiovascular Disease Risk Factors in Rural Communities in North Carolina
clinical_study.official_title: Reducing Cardiovascular Disease Risk Factors in Rural Communities in North Carolina

lead_sponsor.agency: University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill

collaborator.agency: National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute (NHLBI)

clinical_study.source: University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill

brief_summary.textblock: The study will determine the feasibility and efficacy of adapting an evidence-based intervention (EBI) to reduce cardiovascular disease (CVD) risk factors in rural African American communities and determine the acceptability of mobile technology in these communities to support behavior change.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and 6 months after initiated treatment
primary_outcome.description: Change in weight as measured by a scale

primary_outcome.measure: Self reported acceptability of the program
primary_outcome.description: Participants report on the overall intervention and training satisfaction (11 item) and content and utilization of intervention (7 item)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in percentage of participants with controlled blood pressure, from baseline to 6 months
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and 6 months after inititated treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Controlled blood pressure is defined as 140 (systolic)/ 90 (diastolic)

arm_group.description: This group will be the first to receive the adapted intervention, "Heart Matters" (adapted from the PREMIER intervention). The intervention will be 12 months long.
This delayed intervention group will receive the adapted intervention, "Heart Matters," six months after the T1 Intervention group. The intervention will be 12 months long.

intervention.description: "Heart Matters" is an intervention adapted from PREMIER, an evidence-based, comprehensive lifestyle intervention that focuses on blood pressure as the primary outcome. To assess the feasibility and efficacy of adapting PREMIER for rural African Americans, Heart Matters will be delivered to multiple intervention groups, but at two different stages.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- African American
- Aged 21 and older
- Has at least one of the following cardiovascular disease (CVD) risk factors: pre-diabetes, hypertension, obesity, family history of early CVD, prior CVD
- Reside in Nash or Edgecombe counties of North Carolina
Exclusion Criteria:
- Evidence of active or unstable CVD
- Cognitive impairment that limits informed consent
